Elhovo is a Bulgarian town in Yambol Province, located on the left bank of Tundzha river, between Strandzha and Sakar mountains. The town of Elhovo is a center of civilizations since ancient times in the lands along the river of Tundzha. Staying there you will have the opportunity to explore and observe the whole area and feel the spirit of the local people. Don't miss to see the three reserves located along the river of Tunzha, discover the Thracian heritage, exceptional ethnography, cultural heritage and extraordinary natural landscapes.

Elhovo is linked with major roads to the rest of the country and the neighboring Turkey, Greece, and Romania. It is located in border area with beautiful nature, in the Southeast part of Thracian lowlands, in the lower course of Tundzha valley, between Strandza and Sakar mountains. It is 339 km away southeast away from Sofia, at 60 and 37 km south of  Sliven and Yambol, at 30 km northeast of Topolovgrad, at 94km and 66km  southwest from Bourgas and Sredetz.
Just because Elhovo is a small town you can easy reach every point with a short walk.

is a group of mystic Thracian rock circles located 4 kilometers sought from the village of Melnitsa. They are more than 200 scattered over 245 meters altitude in the beautiful landscape of Derventski hills. The names of this terrains are  “Mochukovi kamani” and “Mircholovi kamani”. The specific circles are ancient cult to the God Sun and that's why local people call them Thracian Suns. Through this rocks pass tourist trail “Drunchi dupka”. It is thematic trail which shows 2 groups of this circles and the beautiful landscape of the region. All this sights take visitors to an ancient and mystic world.
. Thracian dolmens are one of the most important archeological findings from ancient Thracia in Elhovo area. They are found near the village of Golyam Dervent just next to the border with Republic of

. Dolmens are the oldest Thracian tombs. They have rock structure build from few natural stones. Thracian people used them to bury seniors of the tribal aristocracy. Similar megalithic structures are preserved in Western Europe and the Caucasus. In the Balkan Peninsula they are found only in the Eastern Rhodopes, Sakar and Strandja.
The most common dolmens are single chamber, rarely has a two-chamber. Both types can be with or without entry corridor (dromos). The larger of the two dolmens near the village of Golyam Dervent was investigated in 2007. It is consists of two cameras and dromos (entrance) and dated from IX - VIII century BC.
People feel indescribable feelings when see dolmen - real historical monument aged at least 3,000 years ago. Questions like Who built them? Why? How has overcome these burden huge stone blocks? What means this strange structure? What is it for? even today excite humanity and make these sites filled with mystery and charm.
